com.fluidops.ajax.components

Class FTable

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.fluidops.ajax.components.FComponent
      • com.fluidops.ajax.components.FContainer
        • com.fluidops.ajax.components.FTable
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FEventListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FKeyValueTable, FSelectableTable

    public class FTable
extends FContainer
    This class represents a UI table view. It renders the contents backed by a TableModel. - resize is possible with own java script extension - sortable and resize behaviour can be defined with setter functions
    Author:
    as, uli

      • FTable

        public FTable(java.lang.String id)

      • FTable

        public FTable(java.lang.String id,
      javax.swing.table.TableModel model,
      int numberOfRows,
      double[] columnWidth)
        Creates a new FTable 2 with given ID and table model. In addition numberOfRows and columnWidth can be specified Note: - sortable by default, but not resizable. Use setter functions to change - table control is rendered if more pages are available or if showTableControl flag is set to true (default is false)
        Parameters:
        id -
        model -
        numberOfRows - the number of rendered rows if -1 "model.getRowCount()" rows are rendered, but at most DEFAULT_VISIBLE_ROWS if -2 "model.getRowCount()" rows are rendered
        columnWidth -

    • Method Detail

      • setShowCSVExport

        public void setShowCSVExport(boolean showCSVExport)

      • addCustomRenderer

        public void addCustomRenderer(java.lang.Class<?> objectClass,
                     FTable.ClassRenderer<?> renderer)
        Adds a custom object renderer to the table Object renderer determine how an object is rendered within a cell. The renderer is determine according to the class of the particular cell's object. If no renderer is found for object.getClass() the default renderer is used, which uses the toString() method as defined in the object. Note: existing renderers are overwritten. Hence pay attention when overwriting the default renderer, i.e. for objectClass Object.class
        Parameters:
        objectClass -
        renderer -

      • reApplyFilter

        public void reApplyFilter(boolean triggerPopulateView)
        Wrapper for reApplyFilter(boolean, FTextInput2). Uses filter textfield depending on which one is used in table.

      • reApplyFilter

        public void reApplyFilter(boolean triggerPopulateView,
                 FTextInput2 filter)
        Re-applies the filter to the table rows. Also resets pagination to page 0. Note: filtering will look at the toString() of the contained objects Note 2: includes call to updateSorter()
        Parameters:
        triggerPopulateView - Whether or not this method should enforce the sending of client updates after the filter has been applied, to propagate the effects of filtering to the UI

      • setSortingLimit

        public void setSortingLimit(int sortCriticalRowCount)
        Sets the critical (maximum) number of rows after which sorting will generally get disabled. This parameter will only apply if set before the table is being rendered.
        Parameters:
        sortCriticalRowCount - Row limit, 0 to turn off (no limit)

      • setSortable

        public void setSortable(boolean flag)

        Parameters:

        Define the sortable behaviour for each column Note: - array must have same length as number of available columns in model otherwise sortable behaviour for each column is set to false - if argument is null, sortable behaviour for each column is set to false
        Parameters:
        sortableColumns -

      • onPoll

        public void onPoll()

      • populateView

        public void populateView()
        The goal of this overriding is preventing the double rendering of components that are part of the table body. Without this override, the method FComponent.populateView() of instances within the table would be called twice:
        1. During the invocation of render()
        2. During the invocation of FComponent.populateView() on this
        The double rendering of components may result in a possibly a costly overhead and even in the breaking of such components, e.g. charts, which rely on known div identifiers to rendering relying on javascript code.
        Overrides:
        populateView in class FContainer

      • populateViewAndCallback

        public void populateViewAndCallback(java.lang.String callbackFunction,
                           boolean forceCallback)
        Description copied from class: FComponent
        Populates (redraws) the view and initiates java script callback (if update is available OR forceCallback)
        Overrides:
        populateViewAndCallback in class FComponent
        forceCallback - if true, callback is even initiated if no update available

      • setNumberOfRows

        public void setNumberOfRows(int numberOfRows)
        Set the numberOfRows visible:

        Possible Options

        i >= 0 : nRows = i;
        i == -1 : nRows = MIN( model.getRowCount() , DEFAULT_VISIBLE_ROWS )
        i == -2 : nRows = model.getRowCount()
        Parameters:
        numberOfRows - ( i )

      • update

        public void update()
        empty base implementation,usually called from updatePageComponents which in turn is called from AjaxServlet. override in subclasses, for instance to set new table model, change column width etc.
